name: the bible : people events and places

children.name: bible x
children.definition: bible/ holy bible the christian scriptures, consisting of the old and new testaments or the jewish scriptures, consisting of the torah or law, the prophets, and the hagiographa or writings.
examples: bible-readingclasses are held in the church hall every thursday evening.
bible stories/ study
the bible
verses from the bible
inthebible it says that adam and eve were the first human beings.
bible[c] a copy of this book : cuốn kinh thánh
there was a bible on the table next to her bed.
her parents gave her a bible when she was a young child.
biblical[adj] in or relating to the bible
they named their son isaac after the biblical character.

children.name: exodus x
children.definition: exodus the second book of the bible telling of moses and the journey of the israelites out ofegypt: sáchxuất hành

children.name: genesis x
children.definition: genesis the first book of the bible, which describes how god made the world sáchsáng thế

children.name: gospel x
children.definition: gospel any of the four books of the bible which contain details of the life of jesus christ : sách phúc âm, tin mừng
examples: st mark's gospel/ the gospelaccording tost mark
the gospel[s] the teachings of jesus christ : phúc âm, tin mừng
topreach/ spreadthe gospel

children.name: the new testament x
children.definition: the new testament the second of the two main parts of the bible, containing the books written after the birth of jesus christ :tân ước
examples: the new testament reading

children.name: the old testament x
children.definition: the old testament one of the two main parts of the christian bible, which records the history of the jewish people before the birth of christ : kinh cựu ước

children.name: the apocalypse x
children.definition: the apocalypse in the bible, the total destruction and end of the world :sáchkhải huyền

children.name: adam x
children.definition: adam a character in the bible who was the first man made by god

children.name: eva x
children.definition: eve the first woman, according to the biblical story of how the world was made

children.name: evangelist x
children.definition: evangelist one of the writers of the four books in the bible about jesus christ :tác giả phúc âm

children.name: the messiah x
children.definition: the messiah in the christian religion, jesus christvị cứu tinh

children.name: disciple x
children.definition: disciplea personal follower of christ during his life, especially one of the twelve apostles.tông đồ, môn đệ
examples: jesus' apostles and disciples in the early church felt the importance of prayer ahead of missionary activity.
the disciples
this woman and this man were, in the most concrete way possible, the first disciples of christ.

children.name: the apostles x
children.definition: the apostles/ the apostlesthe twelve chief disciples of jesus christ : môn đệ,tông đồ
examples: at the last supper, jesus christ tells the apostles: ‘now i'm going to turn the water into wine
bishops today are thought to be the successors of the apostles.
christ, the virgin mary, the apostles, saints, angels and religious events are depicted.

children.name: the elect x
children.definition: the electformal in the bible, people who are chosen by god for salvation :những người được chọn
examples: success was a sign that they were one of the elect

children.name: paradise x
children.definition: paradisethe garden of eden (= the place where adam and eve lived, in the bible story) : vườn địa đàng

children.name: eden x
children.definition: eden (alsothe garden of eden) in the bible, the garden where the first humans,adam and eve, lived in perfect happiness before they did not obey god and were ordered by him to leavevườn địa đàng

children.name: promised land x
children.definition: promised land in the bible, thelandofcanaan, promised by god to abraham and his race: đất hứa
examples: figurativeamericawas the promised land for many immigrant families.

children.name: the last supper x
children.definition: the last supper the meal that jesus christ ate with his friends the night before he died:bữa tiệc ly
examples: the eucharist represents the last supper, the final meal that jesus shared with his disciples.

children.name: judgment day x
children.definition: judgment day/ the day of judgment the time when some people believe the world will end and all the dead people will come back to life so that god can judge how everyone behaved when they were alive : ngày phán xét
examples: on the judgment day, when all gather, o god do not put me in company with him.
the last/ final judgment[ s ] ngày phán xét

children.name: the nativity x
children.definition: the nativity the birth of jesus christ, which is celebrated by christians at christmas :sự ra đời của chúa giê-xu
examples: what a truly great mystery is the nativity of our lord!
was there a moon in the sky during the night of the nativity?

children.name: the passion x
children.definition: the passion in christianity, the suffering and death of jesus christ : cuộc khổ nạn của chúa giêsu

children.name: the resurrection x
children.definition: the resurrection (in christian belief) the rising of christ from the dead or the rising of the dead at the last judgement : sự sống lại, sự phục sinh
examples: the burden of paul's argument is to prove that those who deny the future resurrection of christians are wrong.
therefore, christians buried their dead both out of respect for the body and in anticipation of the resurrection at the last judgment.

children.name: the second coming x
children.definition: the second coming the return of jesus christ to earth from heaven that christians expect will happen one day :chúađến lần hai

children.name: the flood x
children.definition: the flood (in the bible) a flood sent by god that covered the whole earth as a punishment đại hồng thuỷ
examples: when asked about the flood and noah's ark, he said that that was a myth.

children.name: the creation x
children.definition: the creation the creating of the universe, especially when regarded as an act of god:sángthế, tạo tác
examples: the big bang was the moment of the creation, and therefore the work of god

children.name: the fall x
children.definition: the fall/ the fall of man the occasion when the first man and woman did not obey the rules of god and were sent away from the garden of eden: sa ngã

children.name: the ark x
children.definition: the ark/ the ark of the covenant(in the bible) a wooden box which contained the writings of jewish law, and which represented to the people ofisraelthe idea of god being present and leading themhòm giao ước

children.name: manna x
children.definition: manna (in the bible) a food which dropped from heaven and preventedmoses and his people from dying of hunger in the desert : bánh manna

children.name: noah's ark x
children.definition: noah's ark/ the ark  (in the bible) a large wooden ship built by noah in order to save his family and a male and female of every type of animal when the world was covered by a flood :thuyền chở ông noah

children.name: the grail x
children.definition: the grail/ the holy grail the cup believed to have been used by christ before his death

children.name: the ten commandments x
children.definition: the ten commandments in the bible, the rules of behaviour which god gave toisraelthrough moses: mười điều răn
examples: commandment[c] often literary a divine rule, especially one of the ten commandments.
the sabbath had to be kept as ordered in the fourth commandment

children.name: epistle x
children.definition: epistle one of the letters written to the early christians by the apostles :thưgửi các tín hữu
examples: st paul's epistle to the romans

children.name: our lady x
children.definition: our lady (in some parts of the christian religion) a name for mary, the mother of jesusđức mẹ

children.name: the virgin mary x
children.definition: the virgin maryin the christian religion, the mother of jesus christ. according to the new testament of the bible, when mary was a young woman an angel came to her from god and told her that she was going to have a baby, although she had never had sex, and that the baby would be the son of god. she is especially important to roman catholics, who have pictures and statues of her in their churches and homes, and who often pray to her for help: đức mẹ đồng trinh

children.name: the madonna x
children.definition: the madonna mary, the mother of jesus christ: thánh mẫu
examples: a picture of the madonna

children.name: the blessed virgin x
children.definition: the blessed virgin a name for the mother of christ : đức mẹ đồng trinh.
